pageContext.claim: “We have very heavy sanctions on Russia right now. I would not and have never even thought about taking them off.”
pageContext.analysis: Dan Fried, veteran State Department official who oversaw sanctions policy until late February 2017, told Yahoo News in June 2017: "“There was serious consideration by the White House to unilaterally rescind the sanctions." In advance of a call with Putin in late January, Kellyanne Conway said that lifting sanctions was "under consideration" as officials prepared for the call.
